intro: Pistacia khinjuk var. glaberrima, commonly known as the Indian date palm, is a deciduous shrub or small tree native to the arid regions of India and Pakistan. It belongs to the Anacardiaceae family and is characterized by its compound leaves and small, clustered flowers. The plant produces edible fruits that are often consumed fresh or processed into dates. It thrives in dry, warm climates and is well adapted to poor soil conditions. Its botanical features make it an important species in traditional agriculture and local ecosystems.
